item.title: ING Netherlands Will Use Big Data To Prevent Fraud
item.description:
ING Netherlands Will Use Big Data To Prevent Fraud

Fighting payment fraud is at the top of the priority list for nearly every financial institution around the world today. ING Netherlands is trying a different approach, as they will trial ThetaRay technology to detect fraudulent behavior. Whether or not this solution will deliver on its promise, remains to be seen, though.

item.title: Petition urges Walmart Canada to accept bitcoin
item.description:
Petition urges Walmart Canada to accept bitcoin

A petition on Change.org is calling on Walmart Canada to accept bitcoin as a form of payment. The petition, initiated Sunday by William Bugden of Orangeville, Ontario, was spurred by the company's ...

item.title: Investor Tim Draper is Still Buying Bitcoin and Now Owns Ether - CoinDesk
item.description:
Investor Tim Draper is Still Buying Bitcoin and Now Owns Ether - CoinDesk

The recent rise in the price of bitcoin shows "people are coming around" to the digital currency, according to investor Tim Draper. Long one of the ecosystem's most active investors, Draper is perhaps best known for buying roughly 30,000 BTC as part of the first government auction of the digital currency held in 2014.

item.title: EB136 - Arthur Breitman: Tezos - A Self-Amending Crypto-Ledger
item.description:
EB136 - Arthur Breitman: Tezos - A Self-Amending Crypto-Ledger

Support the show, consider donating: 1GaLQRuaP6Gyrzza3yViW5ZAvZQnBDuJND (http://bit.ly/28K4Blv) The lack of an explicit governance mechanism has created deep problems for Bitcoin. Ethereum, with the DAO-related soft/hard-fork discussions, may face similar challenges ahead. Yet, already in 2014 Arthur Breitman quietly started working on cryptocurrency network Tezos that has an explicit mechanism to let coinholders vote on protocol upgrades.

item.title: Bitcoin Rival Ether Gains Traction
item.description:
Bitcoin Rival Ether Gains Traction

With a rising market value and a roster of high-profile patrons, Ethereum in recent months has become the next hot thing in cryptocurrencies. Ethereum is an open software platform, comprising a currency called ether, a public "blockchain" ledger for keeping track of transactions and tools for building so-called smart contracts that automatically make payments when their terms are fulfilled.

item.title: Ripple opens office in Luxembourg
item.description:
Ripple opens office in Luxembourg

Ripple announced Monday it has opened an office in Luxembourg. The launch is part of the distributed financial technology company's growing presence in Europe, following the opening of its London h...

item.title: Trace Mayer Predicts Bitcoin Price to Reach US$3,000 After Halving
item.description:
Trace Mayer Predicts Bitcoin Price to Reach US$3,000 After Halving

Trace Mayer, an Austrian economist and an investor in various Bitcoin startups including Bitpay, Armory, and Kraken, has stated in a recent interview that the price of bitcoin could very possibly reach US$3,000 after the bitcoin block reward halving takes place in mid-July.

item.title: Bitcoin Foundation Names South African Investor as New Director - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Foundation Names South African Investor as New Director - CoinDesk

Bitcoin's oldest trade organization has voted in a new executive director. Weeks after outgoing executive director Bruce Fenton notified the board his term was nearing conclusion (rumors suggested he had resigned), the Bitcoin Foundation has named Llew Claasen to the position.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Tightening the Range - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Tightening the Range - NEWSBTC

Here's what we are looking at this evening in the bitcoin price. So the day has drawn to a close out of Europe, and it's time to put out the second of our twice daily bitcoin price watch analysis pieces.
